com.esotericpig.jeso.botbuddy

Class KeyCodes

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.esotericpig.jeso.botbuddy.KeyCodes

  • public final class KeyCodes
extends java.lang.Object
    FIXME: Will this (VK_SHIFT, etc.) work for Mac OS X?

    FIXME: '#' (VK_NUMBER_SIGN) is 'Shift+3' on US keyboard, but no 'Shift' on UK keyboard - have to make it generic somehow (classes?) and choose (class) - default auto-chooses w/ KeyEvent.getKeyModifiersText()

    Since:
    0.3.5
    Author:
    Jonathan Bradley Whited (@esotericpig)
    See Also:
    BotBuddy

      static void generateAndPrintCharCodes()
      Don't use Java reflection to build/generate CODES because it can possibly throw SecurityException, IllegalAccessException, etc.

    • Method Detail

      • getCharCodes

        public static int[] getCharCodes(int keyChar)

      • getCharCodes

        public static int[] getCharCodes(int keyChar,
                                 boolean getExKeyCode)
        Parameters:
        keyChar - code point to look up
        getExKeyCode - true to call KeyEvent#getExtendedKeyCodeForChar() and try that way if null; may still return null
        Returns:
        null if not found, else int[] of keyChar's key codes

      • putCharCodes

        public static int[] putCharCodes(int keyChar,
                                 int[] keyCodes)

      • putCharCodesSafely

        public static int[] putCharCodesSafely(int keyChar,
                                       int[] keyCodes)
        This is only meant to be used for developing this class (or your own).
        Parameters:
        keyChar - code point key
        keyCodes - of KeyEvent value
        Returns:
        result of Map#put(...)

      • generateAndPrintCharCodes

        public static void generateAndPrintCharCodes()
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Don't use Java reflection to build/generate CODES because it can possibly throw SecurityException, IllegalAccessException, etc. Instead, use this method to see what it would generate and then copy & paste the results.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if can't do reflection

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
